Package com.cafean.client.ui

Interface ConnectionLineRenderer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ConnectionRenderer, FullScreenDrawing, javax.swing.undo.StateEditable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DrawnConnection
    public interface ConnectionLineRenderer
extends ConnectionRenderer, javax.swing.undo.StateEditable
    An interface describing a renderer that renders a connection as one or more lines that are a collection of points that may be moved, straightened, or drawn using source/target modes.

    • Field Summary

      boolean addPoint​(java.awt.Point location)

      Return true if a point can be added to the path.

      Return true if a point can be removed from the path.

      Sets the selected state of every connection line to false.

      Gets the label of the connection at the given index.

      Gets a short description of the location on the target component of the connection at the given index

      Initializes and scales this renderer to prepare it to be painted.
      boolean isLineSelected​(int index)
      Gets the selected state of the connection line at the given index.
      boolean isLineSelected​(java.awt.Point location)
      Returns true if the line closest to the given location is selected
      boolean isStraightLine​(java.awt.Point location)
      Returns true if the connection nearest to the given point will be drawn as a straight line between single pair of points.
      void removeClosestPoint​(java.awt.Point location)
      Attempts to remove the closest point in this DrawnMultiJunction's set of points.
      void reset​(java.awt.Point location)
      Resets the line and point handling for the connection line nearest to the given point and repaints the renderer.

      Sets the drawing mode of the connection line at the given index.

      If set to true, the points in this line closest to the given point should be regenerated based on the locations of the connected drawn components.

      Sets the selected state of the connection line at the given index.

      If set to true, the connection nearest to the given point will be considered selected.
      void setStraightLine​(java.awt.Point location, boolean straightLine)
      If set to true, the connection nearest to the given point will be drawn as a straight line between single pair of points.

      • reset

        void reset​(java.awt.Point location)
        Resets the line and point handling for the connection line nearest to the given point and repaints the renderer.
        Parameters:
        location - the Point that should be used to find the closest line

        Adds a path point at the given point, if the point falls on an existing line segment.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the point is actually added.

        Parameters:

      • getCustomPopupItems

        java.util.Vector getCustomPopupItems()

        Returns:

      • getComponent

        AbstractComponent getComponent()
        Returns the component that this connection line renderer is representing in a 2D View
        Returns:
        the AbstractComponent associated with this renderer.

      • setGeneratePoints

        default void setGeneratePoints​(java.awt.Point location,
                               boolean generate)
        If set to true, the points in this line closest to the given point should be regenerated based on the locations of the connected drawn components. If set to false, the user-configured (i.e. moved around) line points should be preserved.

        This default implementation calls ConnectionRenderer.setGeneratePoints(boolean).

        Parameters:
        location - the Point that should be used to find the closest line
        generate - if true, points should be regenerated
        See Also:
        ConnectionRenderer.setGeneratePoints(boolean)

      • isStraightLine

        boolean isStraightLine​(java.awt.Point location)
        Returns true if the connection nearest to the given point will be drawn as a straight line between single pair of points. If false, the normal behavior will be used.
        Parameters:
        location - the Point that should be used to find the closest line
        Returns:
        true if a single straight line will be drawn

      • setStraightLine

        void setStraightLine​(java.awt.Point location,
                     boolean straightLine)
        If set to true, the connection nearest to the given point will be drawn as a straight line between single pair of points. If false, the normal behavior will be used.
        Parameters:
        location - the Point that should be used to find the closest line
        straightLine - true to draw a single straight line

      • isLineSelected

        boolean isLineSelected​(java.awt.Point location)
        Returns true if the line closest to the given location is selected
        Parameters:
        location - the Point that should be used to find the closest line
        Returns:
        true if the line closest to the given location is selected

      • setLineSelected

        void setLineSelected​(java.awt.Point location,
                     boolean selected)
        If set to true, the connection nearest to the given point will be considered selected. If false, the normal behavior will be used.
        Parameters:
        location - the Point that should be used to find the closest line
        selected - true to set the line selected

        Returns:
        true if the connection line is selected
